detailPage.overview: This project investigates the age-old debate: are men or women better with money? By analyzing data from global financial surveys, interviewing experts, and reviewing the latest behavioral research, we uncover surprising trends and challenge common stereotypes. The study also highlights the impact of socialization, education, and access to financial resources on money management skills.

title: Before and After AI: Are we losing the Art of Thinking?
description: Exploring how the rise of artificial intelligence is changing the way we think, solve problems, and make decisions. Are we becoming too reliant on machines, or is AI enhancing our cognitive abilities?
features: Case studies of AI in education and work
Expert interviews on critical thinking in the digital age

detailPage.overview: This research examines the profound impact of AI on human cognition. We trace the evolution of thinking skills from the pre-digital era to the present, analyzing whether AI tools are making us less thoughtful or freeing us to focus on creativity and strategy. The project features interviews with educators, technologists, and psychologists, and offers recommendations for maintaining strong critical thinking skills in an AI-driven world.
